titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Arthur William Ingersoll Papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

bioghist.p: OBITUARY- Arthur W. Ingersoll (Alumnus Magazine, Vol. 54, No. 4, Mar.-Apr. 1969, p. 46)

ARTHUR W. INGERSOLL, Professor Emeritus of Organic Chemistry, died March 11 after a short illness. Professor Ingersoll, a member of the active faculty from 1922 until 1963, served as secretary of the graduate faculty in 1956. He was the author of a laboratory textbook in organic chemistry. A native of Otoe County, Nebraska, he earned B.S. and M.S. degrees at the University of Nebraska and a Ph.D. from the University of Illinois. He was a member of Phi Beta Kappa, Omicron Delta Kappa, and Sigma Xi, honorary scientific society. Survivors include Mrs. Ingersoll, 2305 Elliston Place, Nashville; a son, Arthur William Ingersoll, Jr., Minneapolis, Minnesota; a nephew, James H. Cordner, Murreysville, Pennsylvania, Who grew up in the Ingersoll home; four grandchildren and two sisters.

did.unittitle: Correspondence, outgoing. 109 items, including typed carbons and handwritten drafts.
Correspondence, incoming. 474 items, from 179 correspondents. Abernethy -- Prout.
Correspondence, incoming. 474 items, from 179 correspondents. Quayle -- Zelinski, + incomplete signatues.

Referee work correspondence (Journal of American Chemical Society, Journal of Organic Chemistry, etc.), outgoing and incoming. Outgoing, 59 items. Incoming, 56 items, from George H. Coleman, Marshall Gates, Arthur B. Lamb, and W. Albert Noyes, Jr. Many of the letters have Professor Ingersoll's handwritten comments on the backs.
Correspondence, incoming -- postcards (requests for reprints, notices of arrival of manuscripts, etc.), 183 items.

Manuscripts of articles, handwritten drafts, typed originals and carbons, etc., some including reprint. Note: the first seven are in Professor Ingersoll's order (chronological?); the rest are arranged alphabetically by title.

did.unittitle: Lecture notes and outlines, Vanderbilt University: Chemistry 221, 421, and 523 (stereochemistry)
Chemistry Department, Vanderbilt University: departmental matters, miscellaneous materials

list.item: Includes the following reports, etc., by Professor Ingersoll:
"Chemical Library Needs in the Nashville Area, 1935-36"
"Organization of Proposed Graduate and Research Facilities in the Sciences," 1948
"A Plan for a Junior Departmental Staff"
Also includes material relating to faculty publications, Sigma Xi, Chemistry Library, etc., and an anonymous typewritten poem, "The Midnite Rhyme of Mack the Queer"
